content: Estimating image location solely based on image content is challenging due to the need for contextual information. This study introduces a global meshing strategy for image geolocation, addresses data limitations in training models, and shows how additional information can enhance geolocation inference. Delaunay triangles are found to be effective for geolocation in low volume scenarios. Incorporating additional information improves geolocation inference model performance. Delaunay triangles are effective for geolocation in low volume scenarios compared to quad trees. Time of posting and user metadata can enhance geolocation accuracy by up to 11% for country-level and 3% for city-level localities.
